brainly_data.question:
PLEASE ANSWER ASAP!!! Thank you
The four most important Presidential Cabinet members are generally known as the Secretary of the Treasury, concerned with money and financial policy, the Secretary of Defense, who heads the Department of Defense, the Attorney General, considered the top lawyer for the U.S. government, and the Secretary of State, who takes the lead on which of the following?

Select one:
A. foreign affairs
B. children's and family issues
C. domestic trade policy
D. record-keeping
brainly_data.subject: History

all_answers.question:
PLEASE ANSWER ASAP!!! Thank you
The four most important Presidential Cabinet members are generally known as the Secretary of the Treasury, concerned with money and financial policy, the Secretary of Defense, who heads the Department of Defense, the Attorney General, considered the top lawyer for the U.S. government, and the Secretary of State, who takes the lead on which of the following?

Select one:
A. foreign affairs
B. children's and family issues
C. domestic trade policy
D. record-keeping
all_answers.subject: History
all_answers.text:
The answer is (A.) Foreign Affairs.
"Under the Constitution, the President of the United States determines U.S. foreign policy. The Secretary of State, appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate, is the President’s chief foreign affairs adviser. The Secretary carries out the President’s foreign policies through the State Department and the Foreign Service of the United States." To see more, look at https://www.state.gov/secretary/115194.htm
